ContentClassification.TableDescription: Joint 1939-44^(15) Basic Mortality Table (Excluding Direct War Losses). Basis: Age Nearest Birthday. Minimum Age: 25. Maximum Age: 95
ContentClassification.Comments: Study Data: Based on data from 16 companies that contribute to Joint Committee on Mortality of the Society of Actuaries (SOA). Submissions include standard business excluding non-medical and attained age conversions of term policies. The Committee recognized at the outset that war deaths would prove a serious obstacle but it seemed worth while despite this handicap to use the material available rather than to wait several years for the development of war-free mortality. Accordingly, war losses excluded are the "death claims of service personnel from service-connected causes (including diseases) and of civilians from causes directly connected with the war.” Methodology: Crude rates graduated with a Henderson-A formula. Graduated rates compared to other recent United States (U.S.) mortality tables. No completely satisfactory explanation has been found of the high death rates under age 30. NOTE: In all, four tables were constructed by the committee: (1) A "Fifteen Year Ultimate" Table, designated as the Joint 1939-44^(15) Table, covering the experience on policies in force more than fifteen years. (2) A "Fifteen Year Select" Table, called the Joint 1939-44 "Select" Table, covering policies in force less than fifteen year. (3) A “Ten Year Ultimate” Table, designated as the Joint 1939-44^(10), built by adding the actual deaths in the eleventh to the fifteenth policy years to those used in the Joint 1939-44^(15) Table and similarly adding the tabular deaths, for the eleventh to the fifteenth years to the tabular used in the Joint 1939-44^(15) Table. The Joint 1939-44^(10) Table was further graduated by inspection after applying graduated ratios of actual to tabular by the Joint 1939-44^(15). (4) A Joint 1939-44^(5) Table was similarly constructed and graduated by use of the Joint 1939-44^(10) Table. Data Transcription Errors: None. Data Certified: 06/2013.
